lead_paragraph: Mr. Rahami, accused of carrying out bombings in New York and New Jersey last weekend, had drawn federal attention after he traveled to Pakistan and his father reported concerns.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Julia Preston, William K. Rashbaum, Eli Rosenberg, Eric Schmitt, Nate Schweber and Benjamin Weiser. Doris Burke contributed research.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA, RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and ADAM GOLDMAN

headline.print_headline: Flagged 2 Times, Bombing Suspect Passed Scrutiny
headline.main: Flagged Two Times in 2014, Ahmad Rahami Passed Scrutiny

snippet: Mr. Rahami, accused of carrying out bombings in New York and New Jersey last weekend, had drawn federal attention after he traveled to Pakistan and his father reported concerns....
abstract: Law enforcement officials reveal Ahmad Khan Rahami, suspect accused of bombings in New York and New Jersey, was flagged by custom officials in March 2014 upon his return to United States from almost year-long trip to Pakistan; was also flagged five months later when his father alerted police, concerned over his son's terrorist sympathies, but agents did not pursue deeper inquiry; investigators are scrutinizing Rahami's travel history as well as inspiration for attacks.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
